key_data_points: Timeline spans from Q1 2025 through Q1 2027 (weeks 1-53+)
Dev capacity ranges from 11.2 to 45 SP (story points)

insights: Heavy focus on Wallet product launch with multiple testing phases (UAT 1, UAT 2) and error monitoring before full rollout
Significant team capacity fluctuations due to multiple leaves (maternity, paternity, OOO) impacting delivery throughout 2025-2026
Legal compliance is a major constraint with multiple deadlines for funnel and cancellation flow changes across states
Strategic pivot: Dashboard Initiative paused after Milestone 1 to prioritize CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives
Peak season preparation is critical with specific resource allocation requirements
Multiple system migrations planned for Q4 2025 (Pricing service, Cash Credits, Price Deprecation)
Product discovery and design work runs 1-2 quarters ahead of development
Heavy emphasis on experimentation and analytics (PA - Product Analytics) to validate decisions before full rollout
Cross-functional dependencies noted with Payments team handling certain features (UPM Reactivations)
Ecommerce expansion is a key focus with new product cards, search functionality, and one-time purchase capabilities
Team is significantly frontend-heavy (11 FEs vs 1 BE), which may impact backend-intensive projects

insights: Heavy focus on Wallet implementation with multiple testing phases (UAT 1, UAT 2) and phased rollout (campaigns, full launch)
Significant team capacity fluctuations due to leaves: maternity leave (Areeba until Q4 2026), paternity leave (Bolo 3 months from Oct 17), and various OOO periods

Dashboard initiative was paused after Milestone 1 to prioritize CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) initiatives
OTP (One-Time Purchase) is a major strategic bet spanning multiple quarters with January 2026 target launch
Multiple system migrations planned: Voucher Migration, Cash Credits (W45), Pricing service (mid-Oct)
Peak season planning is critical with specific no-merge periods and DM drops scheduled
Cross-functional coordination across Design, Product Discovery, Engineering Discovery, and PA (Product Analytics) teams
Reactivation strategy involves multiple teams with Payments team handling UPM component
Strong emphasis on post-checkout experience improvements (search, product cards, select cuts)
Engineering capacity is constrained and carefully tracked with frontend-heavy team (11 FEs, 1 BE)

results.doc_title: Research Roadmap & Project Tracking (GCI + IXI + USCI + GCX)
results.purpose: Tracks research projects and initiatives across multiple brands (HelloFresh, Green Chef, Factor_) and markets, organized by strategic anchors with ownership, timelines, and status tracking
key_data_points: Status distribution: 4 Complete, 3 In Flight, 2 Planned, 1 Requested, 1 Deprioritized
Primary markets: United States, Global, Canada, Sweden
Date range: Projects spanning from March 2025 to November 2026
4 team flags: GCI-led (majority), IXI-led, USCI-led, Prod Analytics-led

insights: GCI-led projects dominate the roadmap, indicating centralized research leadership
Strong focus on 'Foundational Insights' as a strategic anchor (9 projects)
Consumer Closeness is a key initiative with parallel campaigns for HelloFresh and Factor_
GCS (Global Customer Survey) system undergoing significant revamp for 2026 to become omnibus-type survey
Several critical strategic questions remain in 'Requested' status without assigned drivers (customer journey in 500 world, cancellation reasons, new verticals)
Cultural Relevance (#3) is a strategic priority with Influencer Marketplace and Social Listening initiatives
Cross-functional collaboration evident with multiple stakeholders (Consulted/Informed) per project
Menu expansion (XXL Menu) is a significant initiative requiring post-launch analysis
Geographic focus heavily weighted toward US and Global markets
Q4 2025 and Q1 2026 appear to be peak activity periods based on project timelines

results.purpose: Pet food subscription pricing strategy and model for different product plans (Fresh, Mixed, Topper, Dry, Air Dried) with pricing principles, methodology, and testing recommendations
key_data_points: Max freezer fill: 1/3 of small NYC apartment freezer
Fresh plan: Match TFD prices (excluding shipping)
Topper plan: 55-62.5% of Fresh price for 50% of product
PC2 margins and ROI are key performance metrics

entities.name: TFD (The Farmer's Dog)
entities.context: Primary competitor benchmark for Fresh plan pricing

entities.name: Ollie
entities.context: Competitor for Fresh plan pricing comparison

entities.name: Pantry Fresh
entities.context: Competitor consideration for Mixed plan positioning

entities.name: TPT
entities.context: Company/platform developing this pricing model

insights: Pricing strategy is anchored to Fresh plan as the headline price, with other plans positioned relative to it
Company prioritizes PC2 (contribution margin 2) and ROI metrics over pure price competitiveness
Six-step pricing methodology: import costs → benchmark competitors → create scenarios → smooth pricing → validate margins → create price steps
Price testing focuses on three areas: architecture consistency, competitor positioning, and customer segment optimization
Strategic emphasis on attracting larger dogs due to higher ROI, suggesting price incentives for larger portion sizes
Pricing architecture principle: identical product quantities should have identical prices across SKUs
Company willing to match competitor prices only if margin economics are viable

GitHub repositories are the primary documentation source for technical projects
Follow-up tracking shows mixed completion status ('x' vs 'o' markers)
Consumer-facing features emphasize self-service and customization (merchandising widgets, menu search, personalized funnels)
Data platform modernization is underway (Unity Catalog, Business Marts, GenAI solutions)
Geographic expansion is supported through multi-region deployment capabilities
Menu Search has been successfully validated across multiple markets (CK, CA, US) before full rollout

results.purpose: Tracks marketing test campaigns and A/B tests for Good Chop across different channels (SEM, Facebook, CRM, Direct Mail) with various promotional offers and pricing structures
key_data_points: Campaign naming convention: Quarter [Channel] Offer Description
Pricing structures: $30, $100, $110, $120, $140, $150 with various discount splits
Promotional items: Ground Beef, Ribeyes, Welcome Kits (A & B), Wings, Steaks
Geographic variants: Standard US and Canada (CA) specific tests
Offer types: Free products (FL/FY), Choose Your Offer, percentage discounts

entities.name: kelly.abrams@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of SEM (Search Engine Marketing) campaign tests for both New Business (NB), Competitor (Comp), and Brand channels

entities.name: yukie.yamamoto@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of Facebook (FB) advertising campaign tests

entities.name: yt@hellofresh.com
entities.context: Owner of CRM, Direct Mail (DM), and older campaign tests; suggests HelloFresh connection or acquisition

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Meat delivery/subscription service running promotional tests

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Parent company or partner organization based on email domain

insights: Good Chop appears to be part of or affiliated with HelloFresh based on owner email domains
Heavy focus on A/B testing different promotional offers and pricing structures across multiple marketing channels
SEM campaigns are segmented by audience type: New Business (NB), Competitor (Comp), and Brand
Most tests compare 2-3 variants (indicated by __ separators and [3] notation)
Discount structures follow a multi-order pattern (e.g., 50-30-20 likely means $50 off order 1, $30 off order 2, $20 off order 3)
Recent activity concentrated in Q2 and Q3 2025, with some legacy tests from 2023
Welcome Kits (A and B variants) are frequently tested promotional items
Ground beef and ribeye steaks are primary promotional products
Canada market receives separate test variants with adjusted pricing
Last modified dates range from June 2024 to July 2025, indicating active ongoing testing program
